title: Override background color in Firefox
content:
I want to change background color in Firefox from white to gray (because my eyes get tired of white)

I try to change it this way: Preferences -> Language and appearance -> Font -> Colors

But it does not work as expected on some complex web sites. All I want to do is to darken the background, but not to change color of other elenments (links, text, scrollbars).

Can I do it in Firefox ? How [Preferences -> Language and appearance -> Font -> Colors] works in Firefox? Perhaps, there is some "override css" for the entire browser?
creator: pprogrammer1234

title: Blocking single webpage of a website
content:
I want to block google homepage, but want search result by typing keyword in browser's search bar.

I tried extension and host file approach, but it will make all of google in-accessible.

So I don't want to see "https://www.google.com" but want to access "https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-e&q=alphabet&safe=strict" its the search result for word alphabet in Firefox with safe search on.
creator: n.ikamaadeel

title: Sync logins (not passwords!) in Firefox
content:
Hi there,

there is wonderful article about firefox sync: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/sync-logins-firefox-desktop What I'm missing (feature, not article) is to have an ability to sync logins but not passwords. That means, checkbox "Logins and passwords" divide into 2 checkboxes(1. "Logins", 2. "Passwords")

This should also improve a security. I'm fine with sharing/syncing login names but not passwords For passwords sharing/syncing between my computers I do use different programs.

Is this possible? Or, can this be considered as a new feature? If this is not a good place for feature suggestion, where should I post/ask?

thanks, Tomas
creator: xhudik

title: youtube doest buffer videos in firefox but other browsers can
content:
Hi, The problem arised when I upgraded the Firefox version from 87 to 88 . I have a sophos firewall which is managed by my organization .At first I thought that it was a problem with the firewall as it worked on other networks , So I complained about YouTube not being able to buffer videos and even it happens it takes too much time like a minute or two to buffer few seconds . But my network admin uses google chrome and it was working on google chrome. And I Don't want to switch to any other browser

What I have tried :-

  • reinstalled Firefox multiple times on different devices
  • refreshed Firefox multiple times , opened Firefox in safe mode
  • tweaked some advanced preferences (it didn't worked)
  • tried other browsers (other browsers don't have a issue on the same network)

Note:- YouTube doesn't have any issue in Firefox 87.0.0 it only occurs on Firefox 88+

I have also attached two photos one of Firefox 87 (showing it is buffering properly ) and one of Firefox 94.0.1 ( showing it is not buffering properly )

Both the Version of Firefox were on same network and tested on same date
creator: rishabhraja8262004

title: Too many copies open
content: Before my desktop system crashed, Task Manager showed that there were 73 copies/instances of Firefox running. Previously Firefox would lock my system after 11 copies had been created---without my knowing it. Right now after restarting my system, there 64 copies of Firefox even though I haven't done any browsing. What can I do to stop Firefox from overwhelming my system?
creator: fidler8

title: All my bookmarks are lost!!!!!!!!!!
content: When I am logged in to my Firefox account always and all the settings are ON - bookmarks, passwords and all, why I cannot restore them after I have reinstalled my WIN 10??? Earlier it used to synch all the items, but as the newer versions are coming, I guess all these features are one by one removed! What a waste!
creator: ambleprashant

title: PDF access
content: I cannot find any way to report problems, this seems to be the only way. When I try to open any PDF file, I have to Browse to find my pdf viewer (Flexipdf 2022). I do that and also check your "Do this automatically" option. Every time I try to open a pdf after that I still have to go through all the same Browse steps. I also set up Flexipdf 2022 in the Applications section of General Settings (Portable Document Format (PDF) (application/pdf)) and it is just deleted or never saved. The next time I look or try to use it, it’s gone. This is obviously a bug in your system, please correct. Thank You.
creator: ddavissci

title: Firefox 93 onwards does not open new tabs in first window
content:
I am using Firefox 94 on Debian Linux (details below). I've been a happy FF user for many years but, ever since I updated to Firefox 93, I've been facing an odd problem.

When I start FF (usually using my system launcher or the command line), the first window that opens will not allow me to open a new tab. Press the '+' button does nothing; trying to open links in a new tab does nothing; etc. Not only this, but it seems like there are other problems (e.g. my adblocker does not seem to be working in YouTube), but I can't confirm this.

When I open a new window from the menu, all functions work normally in the new window. But the original window continues to have these problems.

This isn't a major inconvenience, but it just seems like an odd bug.

One factor that might have something to do with this - I run FF inside Firejail. I start FF via a one line script:

`firejail /opt/firefox/firefox`

Maybe this has something to do with it?

Thanks so much to Mozilla for this wonderful piece of software, and to all of you for helping out with it!
creator: shankargopal2008

title: actualice el navegador y el audio se escucha mal, entrecortado y chicharrea
content: actualice el navegador y ahora el audio se escucha, mal entrecortado y con chicharreo.
creator: judhitlisperguer

title: Gmail
content: In Email, with every other click on a mail item, I get the message "Firefox is not responding." After 15-20 seconds the mail continues, but the same thing happens again, and again. Checking the mail is nerve wrecking.
creator: frankfurtergeorge2

title: How do I restore the original Firefox theme
content:
How do we go back to the original Firefox theme? It had a much better balance of colors and was more pleasing to the eye! The present default grey/white theme is terrible -- no contrast between tabs etc. There are thousands of Firefox themes to choose from, many are very fancy and some very dark (including the photon theme). Who has the time to go through and try them all or to build a new theme. The Firefox group had the perfect theme already built!

Is it so difficult to place the original simple Firefox theme as a selection in the theme library labelled "Original" and make the theme library searchable by name? At the very least it should have been left as an option in the themes category!

In future, updates should give the option of keeping the present default theme.

Very frustrating not to be given the option of the original theme!! David
creator: dhaase

title: Instagram links broken
content:
Ever since the last two updates, whenever I am on Instagram (i have Win 10 PC version) and I click on a photo to see a larger version, I get this message: 

                                         Sorry, this page isn't available.

The link you followed may be broken, or the page may have been removed. Go back to Instagram.

It does not occur on the Instagram stories.

It only happens on Firefox not on Chrome. Chrome works fine.
creator: fangore11

title: printing from browser
content: When I try to print from within Firefox 94.01 the document is printed in the upper left quadrant of letter size paper. The preview and all information on the printer seem fine. If I try to print the same document from Chrome, it works fine. When I tried about:config and typed in paper_data I get a new box open with three options: boolean, number or string. I never get anything beyond that. No list of paper sizes. Nothing. Any help would be most appreciated. Thank you!
creator: sbarnes1915
